  • View page source

Boundary conditions (pyrit.bdrycond)

This modules defines the supported boundary conditions. Besides the standard Dirichlet and Neumann boundary conditions, also Robin, binary and floating boundary conditions are defined. There is a container class that manages all boundary conditions of a problem and can apply them to the system of equations of the corresponding problem.

Boundary conditions and container class

BdryCond(*bcs)

Container class for collecting different boundary conditions for a problem.

BCAntiPeriodic([name])

Class of BCAntiPeriodic with super class BCBinary.

BCBinary(value[, name])

Class of a binary boundary condition.

BCDirichlet(value[, name])

Class of BCDirichlet with super class BCUnary.

BCDummy(value[, name])

Class of a dummy boundary condition object.

BCFloating([name])

Class of BCFloating with super class BCUnary.

BCNeumann(value[, name])

Class of BCNeumann with super class BCUnary.

BCPeriodic([name])

Class of BCPeriodic with super class BCBinary.

BCRobin(coefficient_dirichlet, ...[, name])

Class of BCRobin with super class BCUnary.

Abstract classes

BC(value[, name])

Abstract class of a boundary condition object.

BCUnary(value[, name])

Abstract class of a unary boundary condition object.
